MLDS features a broad spectrum of topics, catering to all developers and IT professionals. Key areas include Artificial Intelligence and Generative AI, covering innovations in NLP, reinforcement learning, and ethical AI applications. The event also delves into Software Development Practices like microservices, cloud-native development, DevOps, and CI/CD, showcasing best practices for building scalable and resilient applications. Other prominent topics include Edge Computing and Internet of Things (IoT) integration, focusing on developing low-latency, real-time applications, along with sessions on cybersecurity, blockchain, data science, web/mobile development, and cloud technologies. MLDS offers something for every developer, blending cutting-edge technologies with practical, real-world applications.

Schedule for 2025

The majority of Conference sessions are curated by the AIM community.

We are in the process of finalizing the sessions for 2025. Expect more than 100 talks at the summit. Please check back this page again.

  • 10:00 - 10:45
    A Pragmatic Path to AI-Driven Business Growth: Harnessing an Agentic Perspective on Enterprise Strategy
    By Chirag Jain Vice President, AI Practice at Genpact

    In this session, Chirag plans to present an Agentic viewpoint to coordinate between essential strategic components as agents in achieving business growth through an AI-focused approach. The session centers around the cooperative roles of AI Practitioners, AI Users, Business stakeholders, Legal teams, Infrastructure Management Groups, Cyber Security Groups, Responsible AI and Governance Committees, Partners, etc. The presentation stresses the significance of a strong legal framework for compliance and risk reduction, as well as the crucial role of Infrastructure Management and Cyber Security in protecting AI-driven projects. The Responsible AI and Governance Committee ensures ethical AI development and execution, with Business KPIs directing AI strategies to align with overarching organizational objectives. The session delves into the interdependent relationship between AI Practitioners and AI Users, highlighting the importance of effective training and collaboration to fully leverage the technology's capabilities. Furthermore, strategic partnerships are underscored as essential for expanding AI capacities, fostering innovation, and realizing sustainable business growth. By cultivating a cohesive Agentic mindset and design patterns, businesses can tap into the combined strength of these strategic components to unleash the full potential of AI-powered growth and innovation.
    HALL 1 (Main) - Keynotes / Tech Talks

  • 10:50 - 11:10
    [Paper Presentation] Life Stage Customer Segmentation by Fine-tuning Large Language Models
    By Nikita Katyal Head of Analytics and AI at Central Retail Corporation

    This research work tackles the challenge of accurately categorizing customers for retailers to enable precise, targeted marketing strategies. It introduces an innovative method leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) to analyze purchase data and identify key product categories, such as baby food or eldercare items, revealing household compositions like families with kids or elders. By integrating historical behavior with LLM-based classification, the approach enhances life stage segmentation, improving customer targeting, sales, and retention. The research paper details the data sources, model architecture, and evaluation metrics used in this segmentation.
    HALL 3 - Tech Talks / Paper Presentations

  • 10:50 - 11:30
    Drive NetZero, Energy Efficiency and Sustainability leveraging AI
    By Sivakumar Selva Ganapathy VP - Software Engineering at Johnson Controls

    Turning Insights into Energy Savings using Generative AI, unlock the performance of Buildings with real-time data visibility. A single pane of glass with advanced analytics, visualization and controls, accelerates operational outcomes, meets certification and regulatory compliance needs while ensuring data security and privacy. Driving Toward Autonomous Buildings.
    HALL 2 - Workshops / Tech Talks

  • 10:50 - 11:20
    Building AI Agents: From Prototype to Production
    By Vikas Mishra Customer Engineer at Google Cloud

    This session will guide you through the process of building AI agents using Google Cloud's Vertex AI platform. Learn about the latest tools and technologies like Agent Builder, Agentspace, NotebookLM, and Vertex Reasoning Engine, and see how they can be used to create AI agents for a variety of use cases. The session will cover everything from prototyping to production, including data preparation, model development, and deployment. You'll also learn about best practices for building and deploying AI agents, including security, scalability, and performance. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced AI developer, this session will give you the knowledge and skills you need to build and deploy AI agents on Google Cloud.
    HALL 1 (Main) - Keynotes / Tech Talks

  • 11:15 - 11:35
    [Paper Presentation] A Context-Aware Multi-Agentic Multi-Modal LLM Architecture for Digital Marketing
    By Vivek Vishwas Vichare Head of Data Sciences and Analytics at Pixis

    Pixie is a framework designed to improve digital marketing through a context-aware, multi-agent large language model (LLM). It supports real-time and offline marketing, using multimodal LLMs for enhanced reliability and performance. Pixie features a primary orchestration agent that coordinates workflows and task-specific agents that perform specialized tasks. By combining various learning techniques and marketing insights, the framework enhances decision-making and operational efficiency. It was tested for accuracy, consistency, and domain-specific problem-solving, showing improved performance in tasks like root cause analysis, campaign planning, and reporting.
    HALL 3 - Tech Talks / Paper Presentations

  • 11:25 - 11:55
    Agentic workforce of the future
    By Rahul Bhattacharya GDS Consulting AI Leader at EY

    We are rapidly accelerating towards a future where humans and intelligent agents will be working side by side to perform business operations and deliver business and technology services. How will this work? What are some pitfalls and how do we manage the risks associated with them? Do we need to create new job functions? Is this a parallel alternate path to AGI?
    HALL 1 (Main) - Keynotes / Tech Talks

  • 11:35 - 13:05
    [Workshop] Building real time applications with Gemini Multimodal Live API
    By Gopala Dhar AI Engineer at Google Cloud, Lavi Nigam Developer Relations Engineer at Google Cloud

    This workshop serves as a holistic learning guide for Google's Gemini Multimodal Live API. Through a structured, hands-on approach, you'll learn how to build sophisticated real-time applications that can see, hear, and interact naturally using Gemini's multimodal capabilities. We will also explore enterprise-grade implementation of the same using Vertex AI.
    HALL 2 - Workshops / Tech Talks

  • 11:40 - 12:00
    [Paper Presentation] Transforming Healthcare with Gen AI: An Innovative Biomedical Chatbot Leveraging Mixture of Experts and Intelligent Retrieval Systems
    By Gayathri Nadella Manager at Cognizant

    This research details the creation of an innovative biomedical chatbot aimed at improving patient question-answering. It employs a mixture of expert models—fine-tuning one LLaMA3 on patient-doctor interactions and another on general biomedical datasets—and combines them via a router. A vector database supports Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) for accurate, context-aware responses. Rigorous evaluation across biomedical datasets highlights its ability to enhance patient engagement and healthcare delivery, showcasing the transformative potential of generative AI in medicine.
    HALL 3 - Tech Talks / Paper Presentations

  • 12:00 - 12:30
    Bridging the Gap: Integrating Business Context into Large Language Models
    By Pranshu Agrawal Lead AI Engineer at MathCo

    Large Language Models (LLMs), trained on extensive internet-scale datasets, demonstrate exceptional performance across diverse tasks. Yet, they often fall short when it comes to grasping the unique nuances of organizational data. As a result, standard LLMs frequently require human intervention to deliver accurate, business-specific insights. Join us for this Tech Talk as we dive into the world of LLMs. Explore the challenges LLMs face with business-specific contexts and how we can make them more effective. Discover strategies for integrating organizational context into models, examine how LLMs utilize this enhanced information, and uncover its transformative impact on the accuracy and specificity of their responses.
    HALL 1 (Main) - Keynotes / Tech Talks

  • 12:35 - 13:05
    Custom ML Solutions: Navigating Challenges and Building Impactful Systems
    By Sakthivel B Director, Data Science at Tiger Analytics

    This session explores the challenges of designing and deploying custom ML solutions for unique business needs. We’ll cover tackling messy data, scalability, fairness, and integration issues, drawing from real-world project experience. Learn strategies to align technical feasibility with stakeholder expectations and discover tools and best practices to streamline development. Whether you're starting out or refining your approach, this talk offers actionable insights to build high-impact, scalable ML systems.
    HALL 1 (Main) - Keynotes / Tech Talks

  • 13:05 - 13:35
    Indian AI at ISRO: AI Beyond Earth
    By Nitish Kumar Scientist at ISRO

    In this talk, we explore the remarkable journey of a young, dynamic team at the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) as they pioneer Artificial Intelligence solutions for both space and terrestrial applications. We delve into the unique challenges of deploying AI systems in orbit—from creating robust models that function in extreme conditions to ensuring reliable decision-making under stringent resource constraints. On Earth, these innovations fuel breakthroughs in advanced computer vision—ushering in new standards for space exploration and satellite technology. We also highlight GYAAN, an outstanding AI Assistant that reaches millions of users including students in Bihar, demonstrating how ISRO’s AI-driven achievements directly contribute to India’s growth. Throughout this session, we reveal the step-by-step innovation process—identifying mission-critical needs, deploying generative AI for research and development, and implementing health-monitoring solutions for space missions.. We examine the successes, lessons learned, and evolving strategies that will shape ISRO’s AI-driven future. This journey of experimentation, perseverance, and creative problem-solving offers invaluable insights for any organization looking to harness AI for impact on Earth and beyond.
    HALL 3 - Tech Talks / Paper Presentations

  • 13:10 - 13:40
    Code Craze: The Battle of the Bots

    Build a help chatbot using RAG & LLM models to interact with structured datasets and a defined context. Put your AI development skills to the test!
    HALL 1 (Main) - Keynotes / Tech Talks

  • 13:40 - 14:00
    [Paper Presentation] Beyond the Mirror: AI Twins for Personalized Interaction Using Large Language Models
    By Suvojit Hore Senior AI Engineer at EXL

    This research explores AI Twins, lifelike digital avatars enabling real-time interaction through advanced AI-driven speech synthesis, expressions, and contextual understanding. It compares two implementations: a closed-source system utilizing tools like Synthesia and Eleven Labs for high-quality video and audio, and an open-source alternative with Nvidia Riva, Nemotron LLM, Wav2Lip, and Sadtalker for speech and lip-sync. Both use Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) and AI Agents for enhanced domain intelligence, offering applications in personalized education, training, customer support, and virtual companionship.
    HALL 3 - Tech Talks / Paper Presentations

  • 14:05 - 14:35
    Deep Learning in Medical Imaging
    By Priya Bhatia Lead Data Scientist at Turing | YouTuber, TechForAllWithPriya

    This session explores how deep learning, particularly CNNs and advanced architectures, is transforming medical imaging. Drawing on research from IIT Hyderabad, it covers applications in detecting diseases through X-rays, MRIs, and CT scans, enhancing diagnostic accuracy. Key topics include challenges in data preparation, interpretability techniques to improve transparency, and how AI integrates into clinical workflows to support radiologists. Ethical considerations and future directions, such as privacy-preserving federated learning, highlight the responsible deployment of AI in healthcare.
    HALL 3 - Tech Talks / Paper Presentations

  • 14:10 - 14:40
    Mastering Video Transcoding - Efficiency, Quality, and Best Practices
    By Arvind Sasikumar Co-Founder, CTO at Quinn

    Videos are everywhere. Over 90% of the content consumed online (by time spent) are videos. Yet, video transcoding is a little understood process in digital media production, streaming, and content distribution. We will dive deep into the technical intricacies and practical methodologies of efficient video encoding and come up with a comprehensive strategy for optimizing video transformations. We will explore the fundamental principles of video compression, including codec mechanics, container formats, and the complex trade-offs between file size, visual quality, and computational complexity. The talk will systematically break down the encoding landscape, covering key technologies like H.264, HEVC, AV1, and emerging standards, and demonstrate how to select the right approach for specific use cases ranging from long form web streaming to short form reels.
    HALL 2 - Workshops / Tech Talks

  • 14:40 - 15:10
    GenAI in Low-Code/No-Code: Democratizing AI for the Masses
    By Prasana Kumar Parthasarathy Head - Data, Analytics, AI at Capco

    Generative AI is no longer just for experts—Low-Code/No-Code platforms are revolutionizing how AI is built and deployed, empowering anyone to create impactful solutions without writing a single line of code. This session unveils how these tools are breaking barriers, enabling faster innovation, and driving inclusivity in AI adoption. Through real-world examples and actionable insights, discover how to harness the power of GenAI to transform industries and democratize innovation for the masses.
    HALL 1 (Main) - Keynotes / Tech Talks

  • 14:40 - 15:10
    Intro to AI agents
    By Siddhant Goswami Co-Founder at 100xEngineers, YouTuber & Tech Influencer

    The session will explore the concept of agents, delving into what they are and their potential applications. It will provide insights into when agents should and should not be used, as well as guidance on utilizing agentic frameworks effectively. Participants will learn about agentic workflows and design patterns, complemented by real-world business case studies to demonstrate their practical impact and value.
    HALL 3 - Tech Talks / Paper Presentations

  • 14:45 - 15:15
    By 2030, traditional sales teams will be history - all thanks to LLM
    By Ayush Singh Co-Founder at SecondBrainLabs, YouTuber & Developer Influencer

    By 2030, the role of traditional sales teams will be radically transformed—or even obsolete—thanks to the rise of Large Language Models (LLMs). These AI-powered tools are redefining how businesses connect with customers, blending advanced conversational capabilities with data-driven insights to streamline the entire sales process. This session will delve into the ways LLMs are automating lead generation, personalizing outreach at scale, and closing deals faster than ever, signaling the dawn of an AI-first era in sales. Join us to uncover how LLMs will shape a future where human sales efforts take a backseat to intelligent, automated systems.
    HALL 2 - Workshops / Tech Talks

  • 15:15 - 15:45
    Framework for Successful Adoption of Data Science solution in Real Business Scenario
    By Bhargab Dutta Chief Digital Officer at Century Plyboards

    Statistically more than 50% data science problem fails to get implemented successfully in real business scenario. This is especially more in case of Indian traditional business houses. More than the solution approaches, major reasons for this failure are - lack of explain ability to business stakeholders and lack of knowledge on bringing human factors from the actual execution team. This session will talk about how a comprehensive ML based solution is developed and successfully implemented in real business scenario with demonstrated value benefits.
    HALL 1 (Main) - Keynotes / Tech Talks

  • 15:15 - 15:35
    [Paper Presentation] AgNet: A Novel AI Agent Network Architecture
    By Manoj Gupta Founder & CEO at Plotch.ai

    A big agentic switch is happening globally due to AI (artificial intelligence), whereby consumers and enterprises are switching to AI agents for task completion in an autonomous way. This paradigm shift due to AI is leading to the proliferation of AI agents in enterprises requiring innovative agent network architectures for better discovery, communication and security of these agents. Here we present a novel agent network architecture where we introduce innovative concepts like agent registry, agent name server, agent text transfer protocol (ATTP), agent private cloud and agent gateway. Quite a lot of parallels have been drawn from the current world wide web (www) Internet architecture, where similar components exist to support discovery, security and communication.
    HALL 3 - Tech Talks / Paper Presentations

  • 15:20 - 16:05
    Deploying agentic workflow in production at scale
    By Anurag Mishra Associate Manager, GDS Consulting Data & AI team at EY , Puneet Narang Associate Director, GDS Consulting Data & AI team at EY

    Many companies are turning to agentic workflows to automate tasks and improve efficiency. But does working multi-agent workflow mean you have a system ready for real- world production? Not quite! Building reliable multi-agent systems comes with challenges—balancing autonomy, managing orchestration, and defining a scalable service architecture. In this session, we’ll uncover the pitfalls of deploying multi-agent workflows at scale and explore best practices for fault tolerance, coordination, and real-world deployment. Ready to move beyond experiments and into production? Join us to navigate the complexities and build truly robust agentic workflows!
    HALL 2 - Workshops / Tech Talks

  • 15:40 - 16:10
    Practitioners guide to accelerate data transformation using LLMs
    By Shakuntala Gupta Technology Consulting – AI & Data, EY Global Delivery Services India, Vikas Sinha Manager, GDS Consulting Data & AI team at EY, Kunal J Turakhia Executive Director, GDS Consulting Data & AI team at EY

    Advanced data transformations accelerators, such as data lineage powered by GenAI are becoming increasingly critical, as industries prioritize data modernization, transitioning from traditional legacy systems to advanced data technologies. This paper delves into the application of LLMs in tracing the data lineage. We will share our direct experiences in addressing the issues, obstacles encountered and the effective strategies we implemented to overcome them. The proposed approach offers several advantages, including improved efficiency, accuracy, reliability and enhanced data security by keeping data knowledge within the enterprises cloud environment. The approach involves custom chunking strategies, hybrid semantic and vector search capabilities, selection of embedding model. Overall, this paper presents an efficient and secure solution for accelerating data lineage task leveraging LLMs.
    HALL 3 - Tech Talks / Paper Presentations

  • 15:50 - 16:20
    Security & Privacy- for AI, by AI
    By Jason Joseph Chief Information Security Officer at mPokket

    With AI applications, infrastructure, and tools getting rolled out at scale, it is important that we focus on the security and privacy around building, deploying, using and governing these applications. My talk will focus on both the technical information security aspects- (vulnerabilities in AI applications and associated tech stacks, treatment/mitigation strategies, proactive, detective and reactive security engineering aspects) and also from the GRC- governance, risk, compliance/legal aspects of both the security and privacy elements.
    HALL 1 (Main) - Keynotes / Tech Talks

  • 16:05 - 16:35
    Agents Ahoy! The Rise of Multi-agent Systems
    By Ashita Prasad Founder & CTO at API Dash

    Discover how to create intelligent agents and multiagent systems using cutting-edge open-source technologies. This talk will explore various frameworks and best practices for building robust collaborative agents and attendees will gain insights into some real-world applications of multi-agent systems.
    HALL 2 - Workshops / Tech Talks

  • 16:15 - 16:45
    Revolutionizing Communication: AI’s Role in Making the Internet Multilingual
    By Himanshu Sharma Co-Founder at Devnagri

    In a world where over 90% of internet users speak languages other than English, the potential for growth lies in inclusivity. This talk will explore how AI is bridging the gap for over a billion users by transforming content into native languages at scale. I Himanshu Sharma, Co- Founder of Devnagri, will share insights on how neural machine translation, voice bots, and foundational language models are reshaping industries—creating opportunities for businesses to connect deeply with regional audiences. Dive into the future of AI-driven localization and learn how innovation is turning barriers into bridges for global communication.
    HALL 3 - Tech Talks / Paper Presentations

  • 16:25 - 16:55
    Accelerating Data, Decisions, and Delivery: The Edge Computing Shift in Earth Observation
    By Akash Yalagach Co-founder & CTO at KaleidEO | SatSure

    Edge computing is revolutionizing earth observation (EO) by enabling satellites to process data directly in orbit, reducing reliance on ground stations for time-sensitive applications. This talk will highlight the benefits of edge computing for earth observation, such as reduced data transfer costs, faster response times in critical scenarios like disaster management, and real-time insights for sectors like agriculture and defence. In September 2023 KaleidEO demonstrated on-orbit processing on EO satellites, showcasing real-time analytics capabilities like change detection and applications for vegetation, forestry and environmental monitoring. By enabling instantaneous data processing, edge computing ensures that actionable intelligence reaches decision-makers without delay, fostering more effective responses to natural disasters, better resource management, and stronger national security. The edge computing innovation for EO marks an important evolution in the traditional approach, unlocking unprecedented potential for near real-time, data-driven, diversified applications from space.
    HALL 1 (Main) - Keynotes / Tech Talks

  • 16:40 - 17:10
    Building the Future: Data Strategies for Modern Supply Chains
    By Ganesh Kaliappan Data Engineering Leader at Philips

    In this presentation, we will explore the current challenges facing the supply chain industry and discuss the critical importance of leveraging data-driven insights to modernize operations. We will delve into the role of data, highlighting key strategies such as data integration, real-time analytics, and predictive and prescriptive insights, alongside the transformative impact of advanced technologies like Generative AI. Additionally, we will examine architecture best practices from the industry, showcasing real-world examples of how organizations have successfully implemented these strategies to drive efficiency and resilience. Attendees will gain a comprehensive understanding of how to harness data to enhance supply chain operations, with concrete insights into effective architectural frameworks and future trends that will shape the supply chain landscape.
    HALL 2 - Workshops / Tech Talks

  • 16:50 - 17:20
    Building the Future of Speech AI: Scaling Voice Technology for Global Content
    By Varshul CW Founder at Dubverse

    In this session, I'll dive deep into the technical challenges and solutions in building enterprise-grade speech AI systems that power content globalization. We'll explore how Dubverse has developed and scaled speech foundation models, including text-to-speech, speech-to-speech and speech-to-text technologies. I'll share insights on optimizing model throughput, handling low-resource languages, and building robust APIs. The talk will cover practical approaches to solving critical problems in voice technology, making it relevant for developers working on speech, audio, or multilingual applications.
    HALL 3 - Tech Talks / Paper Presentations

  • 17:00 - 17:30
    Scaling Computer Vision AI with Intelligent Training Data Pipelines
    By Puneet Jindal Chief Executive Officer at Labellerr

    In this session, I will explore how intelligent training data pipelines are the key to scaling computer vision AI effectively. Imagine the challenge of needing millions of accurately labeled images for a reliable AI model—without the right infrastructure, this can become a bottleneck. I will deep dive into how intelligent pipelines, driven by automation technologies like AI-assisted labeling and active learning, replace tedious manual workflows, drastically boosting efficiency and data quality. Through real-world examples, I will showcase how these pipelines can accelerate annotation processes and improve model accuracy. Engineers will leave with actionable insights on implementing semi-supervised labeling, quality checks, and advanced tools to jumpstart their AI projects with smarter data pipelines.
    HALL 1 (Main) - Keynotes / Tech Talks

  • 17:15 - 17:45
    Explore OPEA
    By Shriram K Vasudevan Lead - Technical APJ (AI, GenAI, Software Tools Ecosystem Specialist) at Intel

    OPEA Empower enterprises to develop and deploy GenAI solutions through an open ecosystem focused on security, scalability, cost efficiency, and agility. The platform offers a detailed framework of composable building blocks, architectural blueprints for retrieval-augmented workflows, and a comprehensive four-step assessment to evaluate performance, features, trustworthiness, and enterprise readiness of generative AI systems. This session will quickly introduce the listeners with OPEA.
    HALL 2 - Workshops / Tech Talks

  • 17:25 - 17:55
    Powerhouse Platforms for Data, ML & AI Ops Mastery
    By Prachi Prabhu Head of Data Platforms at Aramex

    Session will help you define the Platform features for a successful implementation of Ops for Data and identify the challenges
    HALL 3 - Tech Talks / Paper Presentations

  • 17:35 - 18:05
    GenAI and Ethics
    By Sridevi Vadapalli Chief Data Scientist at Daimler Truck Innovation Center India

    GenAI is real. Business transformation using GenAI is also real. It is powerful and pervasive. But a disruptive technologies like GenAI cannot be devoid of issues and more so on biases and ethics. This session is to bring awareness on some of the biases and ethical issues.
    HALL 1 (Main) - Keynotes / Tech Talks

  • 10:00 - 10:45
    Navigating the Path to Production with Enterprise AI Assistants
    By Sourav Banerjee Head of R&D and Platform at MathCo

    As organizations increasingly embrace AI to drive actionable insights and automate workflows, the initial excitement around the technology gives way to a focus on delivering tangible value. This shift has placed the spotlight on deploying Large Language Model (LLM) applications in production environments. MathCo’s experience across diverse use cases has shown that a successful AI strategy requires more than cutting-edge foundational models. It demands a strong foundation built on high-quality data, thoughtful design, business context, rigorous testing, and effective change management. In this session, Sourav Banerjee will explore the essential building blocks of enterprise assistants, with compelling examples from the healthcare and consumer packaged goods (CPG) industries. He will delve into their evolution from prototypes to production, uncovering the challenges and strategies to overcome them.
    HALL 1 (Main) - Keynotes / Tech Talks

  • 10:50 - 11:10
    [Paper Presentation] Database Search: Text2SQL using dynamic few-shot prompting with self-consistency using LLM
    By Utkarsh Tripathi Principal Data Scientist, Micron Technology

    This research work presents a dynamic few-shot prompting approach with self-consistency to improve Text2SQL accuracy using large language models (LLMs). By categorizing and masking irrelevant information in few-shot examples, the method enhances contextual understanding and scalability across domains. Utilizing similarity-based dynamic example selection and self-consistency, the approach achieves ~94% accuracy on 1,100 queries, demonstrating its effectiveness in generating precise SQL queries from natural language inputs.
    HALL 3 - Tech Talks / Paper Presentations

  • 10:50 - 11:35
    [Workshop] Developing Conversational AI Assistants with Contextual Understanding
    By Adithi Y Pai Platform Product Manager, MathCo, Amit Kumar Pal Lead AI Engineer at MathCo

    Even the most advanced AI assistant falls short of its potential without the right context. In this workshop, we will uncover how to transform a standard AI model into a truly agentic system by integrating multiple data sources—both structured and unstructured. Through real-world examples, we will build a conversational assistant that understands queries, incorporates essential organizational context, identifies the appropriate skill set, and provides accurate, actionable responses. We will also tackle the practical realities of deploying such systems in production, sharing proven strategies to overcome challenges and ensure accuracy, reliability, and scalability in real-world applications.
    HALL 2 - Workshops / Tech Talks

  • 10:50 - 11:20
    How GenAI will unlock the future of Software Development and Businesses
    By Arsh Goyal YouTuber | Senior Software Engineer, Samsung

    Generative AI (GenAI) is revolutionizing software development and business operations, driving unprecedented productivity and innovation. In software development, GenAI is automating coding, testing, and optimization processes, accelerating development cycles and reducing technical debt. It enhances developer productivity by 20-50% through automated code generation and intelligent debugging, allowing professionals to focus on complex problem-solving. For businesses, GenAI is transforming operations through enhanced natural language processing, multimodal AI, and personalized customer experiences. The economic impact is substantial, with GenAI projected to contribute $6.1 to $7.9 trillion annually to the global economy. Despite challenges like potential job displacement, GenAI is creating new opportunities, with 97 million new jobs projected by 2025, reshaping industries and unlocking new frontiers of innovation. This talk will explore how GenAI is not just an incremental advancement, but a paradigm shift that is redefining the very nature of software development and business operations, unlocking new frontiers of possibility in the digital age.
    HALL 1 (Main) - Keynotes / Tech Talks

  • 11:15 - 11:35
    [Paper Presentation] Harnessing AI for Detection and Correction of Hallucinations in Large Search System
    By Ratnesh Singh Parihar Principal Architect at Talentica

    This research work presents an approach to tackling a core challenge in designing a robust e-commerce search system for over 10 million stock-keeping units (SKUs). The system employs AI models (OpenAI, Llama 3) for three major functions: categorization, tagging, and semantic searching using vector embeddings. Categorization refers to classifying incoming information from different third parties into a taxonomy essential for data accuracy and standardization. Tagging aids search by linking relevant tags for easier SKU filtering. Lastly, vector search, using Elastic Search and cosine similarity, enables efficient searches and retrieval of relevant information. To enhance tagging and categorization accuracy, mathematical models using embeddings and cosine similarity were applied to reduce hallucination effects.
    HALL 3 - Tech Talks / Paper Presentations

  • 11:25 - 11:55
    The Rise of AI That Actually Reasons: A New Era in Machine Intelligence
    By Rohit Thakur GenAI Lead at Synechron

    This talk explores the evolution and capabilities of reasoning-focused large language models (LLMs) compared to traditional LLMs trained on next-word prediction. Traditional LLMs excel at in-context learning but struggle with complex reasoning tasks due to their design. New reasoning-optimized models, like Deepseek R1 and OpenAI’s o1, overcome these limitations through techniques like chain-of-thought reasoning and GRPO. The session highlights practical use cases. Attendees will learn how to adapt prompts and workflows to maximize the potential of reasoning LLMs in coding, planning, medical diagnosis, and beyond.
    HALL 1 (Main) - Keynotes / Tech Talks

  • 11:40 - 12:00
    [Paper Presentation] Assessing the Capability and Generalisation of Large Language Models in Consumer Credit Evaluations
    By Shubhradeep Nandi Chief Data Scientist - Data Analytics Unit, Govt. of AP

    This research introduces an innovative taxpayer risk prediction approach leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs). Taxpayer data is transformed into detailed natural-language profiles, enabling fine-tuning of pre-trained LLMs for precise and nuanced risk assessment. Unlike traditional methods, this approach identifies hidden patterns, offering deeper insights into taxpayer behavior. Preliminary results show improved accuracy and decision-making capabilities for financial departments. The research emphasizes the transformative potential of LLMs in modernizing fiscal oversight and ensuring effective governance amid evolving financial landscapes and taxpayer risks.
    HALL 3 - Tech Talks / Paper Presentations

  • 11:40 - 13:10
    [Workshop] Building Scalable Multi-Agent Systems with Gemini: From Scratch to EV Industry Report
    By Gopala Dhar AI Engineer at Google Cloud, Lavi Nigam Developer Relations Engineer at Google Cloud

    Dive into the world of multi-agent systems and learn how to build them from the ground up using Google's Gemini AI models. This hands-on workshop will guide you through essential design patterns and architectural components for creating robust, scalable multi-agent applications. Using a unified Gemini SDK compatible with both Google AI Studio and Vertex AI, we'll implement features like function calling, structured output, tool integration, and real-time web search to augment Gemini's capabilities.   • 17:30 - 18:00
    LLMs Will Always Hallucinate, and We Need to Live With This
    By Sourav Banerjee Founder and CTO at United We Care

    This talk draws from the paper "LLMs Will Always Hallucinate, and We Need to Live With This" and presents a critical analysis of hallucinations in large language models (LLMs), arguing that these phenomena are not occasional errors but inevitable byproducts of the models' underlying mathematical and logical structures. Leveraging insights from computational theory, including Gödel’s First Incompleteness Theorem and undecidability results like the Halting, Emptiness, and Acceptance Problems, the talk will demonstrate that hallucinations arise at every stage of the LLM process—from training data compilation to fact retrieval and text generation. By introducing the concept of Structural Hallucination, we assert that hallucinations cannot be entirely eliminated through architectural improvements, dataset refinement, or fact-checking mechanisms. Instead, this work challenges the prevailing belief that LLM hallucinations can be fully mitigated, proposing instead that we must adapt to and manage their inevitability as a structural characteristic of these systems.

    As AI becomes increasingly crucial to enterprise success, we see companies moving deeper into a technological frontier that promises both opportunity and risks. The advent of generative AI has driven a surge in AI use cases throughout organizations. So, how are companies preparing—or not preparing—to keep pace with this rapidly evolving technology and avoid unintended consequences, both known and unknown? Join the session to get answers on below: 1. Who are the executives representing organizations with larger AI governance budgets? 2. Do organizational investments in AI governance reflect a sense of urgency? 3. How many new AI models are in the enterprise forecast? 4. What kinds of AI tools and frameworks are organizations using? 5. Are respondents confident that their AI capabilities can meet the challenges ahead? 6. Which AI risks and regulations worry enterprises the most? 7. Who owns organizations’ AI governance?
    HALL 1 (Main) - Keynotes / Tech Talks

  • 15:20 - 15:50
    Powering the Last Mile: How Data & AI Drive Real-World EV Solutions
    By Satish Mittal Co-Founder & Chief Digital Officer at Chargeup

    Among a lot of noise and news around data & AI, it would be pragmatic to look at what are the real solutions for real people. At Chargeup, we created last-mile Mobility solutions for EV drivers using data captured through IOT, and urn analysis on Assets and People and thus created unique AI/ML models for last-mile EV drivers. Watch this space for listening to "Real Solutions for Real People Solving Real World Problems.
    HALL 2 - Workshops / Tech Talks

  • 15:25 - 15:55
    Video Search and Autonomous agents in video creation and editing workflows
    By Abhijeet Singh Co-Founder at BingeClip AI

    World has moved from drag and drop timeline based editors. Text to video is a paradigm which makes video creation and distribution a verbal skill. This takes this confined ability to the hands of every person who can think creatively and has a story to tell. But chatting with a video creation & editing agent has its own set of challenges, especially for the user asking for high content control as well as ease of creation. Existence of 1000+ languages poses another dimension in these challenges. BingeClip AI is configuring a set of technologies which include Agentic RAGs, Automated document workflows, Proprietary video search models, autonomous agents for editing operations and model compression. The combination creates a seamless application layer which enables user interaction, hence video creation on the move, combining authenticity of UGC with creativity & Automation of AI.
    HALL 3 - Tech Talks / Paper Presentations

  • 15:50 - 16:20
    Gen AI from data pipelines to products
    By Ravi Variar India Chief Technology Officer at Morningstar

    This talk explores the strategies and best practices for designing and deploying data pipelines at scale. It will delve into how these pipelines are structured to handle large volumes of data efficiently and ensure seamless data flow across systems. By examining real-world examples, the session will demonstrate how robust data pipelines contribute to enhancing the functionality, performance, and user experience of software products. Attendees will gain insights into the tools, techniques, and considerations necessary to build scalable and reliable data pipelines that drive product innovation and business value.
    HALL 1 (Main) - Keynotes / Tech Talks

  • 15:55 - 16:25
    Measuring AI Product Performance
    By Lalit Balla Head of Analytics Centre of Excellence at Airbnb

    To effectively measure AI product performance, it is essential to establish clear metrics that reflect the desired outcomes. Key performance indicators (KPIs) should encompass accuracy, efficiency, user satisfaction, and overall impact. Continuous monitoring and evaluation against these KPIs will help identify areas for improvement and optimize functionality. Furthermore, incorporating user feedback can enhance product relevance and adaptability. Ultimately, a comprehensive performance measurement strategy will drive the success and evolution of AI products.
    HALL 2 - Workshops / Tech Talks

  • 16:00 - 16:20
    [Paper Presentation] Deep learning approach for addressing Uncertainty of ageing and sudden death behaviour in Lithium-ion cells
    By Praveen Prasanth KV Technical Leader-System Simulations & AI/ML at Renault Nissan Tech

    This research explores deep learning models to predict the aging and sudden death behavior of lithium-ion batteries (LIBs), critical for automotive energy systems. Traditional models struggle with LIB aging complexity, while DL models like LSTM, GRU, TCN, and Transformers effectively forecast capacity degradation and unexpected failures. Using data from 124 cells with diverse lifetimes, advanced data practices enhanced model accuracy. Metrics like RMSE and R² validated performance, highlighting DL's potential in improving LIB management and automotive system reliability.
    HALL 3 - Tech Talks / Paper Presentations

  • 16:25 - 16:55
    Building Scalable E-commerce Infrastructure for Bharat’s Billion-Plus Users
    By Kiran Kumar Katreddi Vice President, Platform Engineering at Meesho

    Building scalable e-commerce infrastructure for Bharat’s billion-plus users involves designing systems that can efficiently handle immense user volume, diverse regional needs, and fluctuating demand. This requires a robust, flexible technology stack that supports high-performance operations, from real-time personalization and AI-driven recommendations to regional language support and optimized logistics. By focusing on affordability, accessibility, and the unique shopping behaviors of users in tier 2+ markets, e-commerce platforms can create a seamless experience that empowers India’s vast, diverse population. This approach not only ensures inclusivity but also drives sustained growth by meeting the specific requirements of Bharat’s rapidly expanding digital economy.
    HALL 1 (Main) - Keynotes / Tech Talks

  • 16:25 - 16:45
    [Paper Presentation] LLM based Agentic Framework to assist with IT incidents
    By Chandan Kumar Agarwal Principal Engineer at Atlassian

    This research introduces an LLM-based agentic framework aimed at reducing Mean Time to Recovery (MTTR) during IT incidents. The conversational AIOps Incident Management bot assists on-call personnel by recommending resources, referencing similar past incidents, and suggesting collaborators. It also automates tasks like generating post-incident reports and creating Jira issues for follow-up actions. The framework integrates root cause analysis, resolution guidance, and quality monitoring to enhance efficiency, user engagement, and overall incident management in complex IT service environments.
    HALL 3 - Tech Talks / Paper Presentations

  • 16:30 - 17:00
    Rise of Agentic AI in the Finance World
    By Ekta Shah Associate Data Scientist at MSCI

    This talk explores the transformative role of agentic AI in the finance sector, highlighting its impact on trading, risk management, fraud detection, and personalized financial services. We will discuss how AI systems analyze vast datasets to enhance decision-making and improve operational efficiency, while also addressing the ethical considerations and challenges posed by their deployment. As financial institutions increasingly rely on AI-driven solutions, understanding both the opportunities and risks is crucial for navigating this rapidly evolving landscape. Join us to discover how agentic AI is shaping the future of finance and what it means for businesses and consumers alike.
    HALL 2 - Workshops / Tech Talks

  • 16:50 - 17:10
    [Paper Presentation] Vision-Powered RAG Agents for Organizational Software and Web Operations
    By Gaurav Adke General Manager Data Scientist at Michelin

    This research work introduces an autonomous large multimodal (LMM)-based agent for automating software and web operations using enterprise knowledge. The agent performs repetitive web tasks, automates decision-making, and enhances precision through retrieval-augmented generation (RAG). It leverages HTML parsing to create unique identifiers and integrates self-evaluation tools for task execution. Achieving 40% accuracy on open websites and higher on internal pages, it demonstrates a 24% improvement in precision. Key metrics include execution steps, token cost, and self-reflection capabilities.
    HALL 3 - Tech Talks / Paper Presentations

  • 17:00 - 17:30
    From Data to Intelligence: Transforming Industries with AI and Data Science
    By Shabbir Badra Vice President Information Technology at Apraava Energy

    Data Science and Artificial Intelligence (AI) are at the forefront of technological innovation, driving significant advancements across various industries. These fields leverage vast amounts of data to uncover insights, automate processes, and create intelligent systems that can perform tasks traditionally requiring human intelligence.
    HALL 1 (Main) - Keynotes / Tech Talks

  • 17:05 - 17:35
    State of Quantum Algorithms and Software
    By Sreekuttan L S Co-Founder and CEO at Bloq

    In this talk, I will provide an overview of quantum algorithms, focusing on key areas like Quantum Machine Learning (QML), Quantum Optimization (QO), and Quantum Simulation (QSim). I'll also introduce Bloq Quantum's role in simplifying quantum adoption and discuss the broader quantum software landscape. We'll explore the leading quantum cloud platforms, including AWS, Azure, GCP, and IBM, comparing their offerings and the impact of cloud on the future of quantum computing.
    HALL 2 - Workshops / Tech Talks

  • 17:15 - 17:35
    [Paper Presentation] GenAI-Enhanced Intellectual Capital Development for Effective Case Deflection and Support
    By TND Tulsi Dashsharma Data Science Analyst at Cisco Systems

    This research work presents a systematic approach to case deflection, enabling customers to resolve issues independently, reducing the need for support. It develops Intellectual Capital (IC) through analyzing documentation and engineer case notes, using a predictive model with supervised learning and NLP to classify bugs for digitization. The model prioritizes high-potential bugs, optimizing workflows and resource allocation. Large language models (LLMs) automate IC document creation, improving consistency and reducing manual effort. This AI-driven process enhances decision-making, customer satisfaction, and operational efficiency.
    HALL 3 - Tech Talks / Paper Presentations

  • 17:35 - 18:35
    Closing Standup Act by Kumar Varun

    Kumar Varun is an Indian stand-up comedian, actor, writer and quizmaster. He is known for his roles in the comedy sketches of All India Bakchod, as the co-founder of the comedy collective Random Chikibum, which won the OML Comedy Hunt.
    HALL 1 (Main) - Keynotes / Tech Talks
